item.description:
Hi Everyone,

I have added the kayaks available at the bottom of the page also.

Today: Sunny, with a high near 89. North northwest wind between 8 and 11 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

Wind from N will negate current effects so should still be a fine trip.

http://www.usairnet.c...

We will be in a sheltered area and not on open water so the wind will be of low distraction, but enjoyable in the warm while relaxing

grill is loaded and ready to go...
i have some hut doags left over from yesterday, and will being some Tahlapia what ever kind of fish that is..never had it so its my first...LOL


Some of us discussed we may be interested in a simple paddle event at this location,
THIS CAN ALSO BE JUST A SIT IN THE SUN EVENT FOR THOSE NOT PADDLING.
Its not a long trip but mostly some paddling FOR MAYBE AN HOUR or two or whatever...( some can paddle to the GOURGE and some upstream..etc.....and then relaxing by the river and having a pot luck barbie-q.

The location is called Curtis Park, a socker AND baseball field , but on the river side OF THE PARK there is a dirt road leading towards the river where there is a put in area..

bring A CHAIR, some food and favourite beverage...


Getting There:
From Hartford direction:

91 North to exit 36,

Take left (west direction) on to 178 (park ave) toward Bloomfield for 1.6 miles.

At intersection take right onto 187 (north direction) (Blue Hills Ave) for about 5 miles heading toward Tariffville direction.

You will meet rte 187/189,

Stay on 189 to Tarriffville..at the end of the extension you will end up in Tariffville,
take a left at the light onto rte 315 (Elm st) follow it to the end at the stop sign take the left into Tarrifville Road (the street sign says Withrop, thats the raod to the right though)..continue on 315 for about 1.2 miles,
take a right into Curtis Park (right side) and go to the river via the dirt road..

ok if you use Mapquest, GPs or other..there is 2 Tariffville Roads in the town and the numbers don't match right....
so just look at your map for Curtis Park..based the directions given above..
for a general landmark - its near rte 315 and 202 intersection

other info and map picture:
http://connecticut.qu...

see those that are interested...

xxxxxxx
Kayaks available:

Paddle & Leash, Life Jacket with whistle is included with any of my yaks.

Dougnation of SOMETHING ? NOT MUCH TODAY, bucks for my kayaks reserved for this particular event.
Its way less than what sport shops charge and the yaks & Paddles are top quality dillivered and picked up at the site etc..

Please make sure you are familiar with the yak you choose and can fit in them since i don't have any wide yaks anymore.


I will only bring the yaks that are confirmed by a yes and by persons i have some familiarity with..

Maybee's obviously can't reserve any yaks and if ya reserve one and don't show up ya won't ever get a second chance to again.

Sorry i don't like to leave un-attended yaks on the trailer. They get stolen too easily.


IF USING MY YAKS YOU CANT LOOK LIKE A BONEHEADED BEGINNER AND STEP INTO THEM VIA THE FLOOR OR DRIVE UP ON SHORE WITH THEM LIKE YOU ARE GOING TO A DRIVE IN MOVIE. Only Novices in cheap boats do that...

READ THE INFO ON THE FOLLOWING LINK: I will also show you the correct way and you will look like a intelligent seasoned pro and impress the others who don't know how. Or you may laugh at the ones that fall in who don't know how.
http://www.ehow.com/h...
Hint: always get out parallel to shore.

Please review the links below for the equipment specifications to be at least familiar with which boat or equipment you would be best suited for.

Cheap LIfe Jackets with a whistle is all i have for you since a GOOD QUALITY LIFE JACKET should be chosen for your particular body shapes and paddling style, and tight fit adjusted...if you have your own please bring it..
------------------
All my yaks come with Werner Carbon Kalliste Paddles (my recommended brand and type). Different lengths and types of the same version are in the bucket.

http://www.wernerpadd...

(No ya cant use these paddles for paddle float entry practice. i have some cheap ones for that.)-
------------------

Also for comfort is my favourtie Yak Pad optional accessory to all yaks on trips that we are actually going somewhere..

http://www.yakpads.co...


----------------------

Cobra Expidition, Yellow, Rudder Equipped.
For an average sized paddler apx (150 to 220 lbs) with Intermediate experience.

http://www.cobrakayak...

Fast Sea kayak, Sit On Top type, moderate to low initial stability, 18', = THIS KAYAK IS FOR SALE $500.00.....I will have this at the event to try if reserved... = AVAILABLE .
I am only selling this one since i don't have enough room to store it..8 yaks was enough
only room for 6 of em now.

------------------------------

Eddyline Wind Dancer, Red, Rudder Equipped.
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with Novice and up skills.

http://www.epinions.c...

highly stable (initial & secondary) comfortable Sea kayak, 18'=
- JILL

---------------------------------

NDK Greenlander Pro, Red, Skeg Equipped.
Medium sized paddler (150-200 lbs) with Intermediate to Advanced skills.

http://www.atlanticka...

fast Greenland style Sea kayak, moderated stability, 18'= AVAILABLE BUT NOT ENOUGH SPACE TO TRANSPORT .

----------------------------------

Necky Eliza Composite Ultra Light (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.

http://www.belhavenca...

stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak, 15'3.0"= - Melody

------------------------------------

Necky Eliza Composite Ultra Light (Modified), Yellow, Skeg Version.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.

http://www.belhavenca...

stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak, 15'3.0"= - Bette-

-----------------------------------

Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.

http://www.neckykayak...

stable and predictable Transitional type moderate weight (50 LB) ladies kayak, 15'3.5"= - KATHERINE-

----------------------------------

Guillemot Night Heron

Greenland Paddle available also if desired.

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 150 - 220 Lbs) with beginner/intermediate and up skills.

http://www.guillemot-...

Overall a stable and predictable Sea kayak with Greenland style hull (45 lbs), 18' =
-/b] Al-r


al-r
item.how_to_find_us: Kayak Trailer at end of dirt road right by the river bank.

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: Sunday Afternoon paddle and pot luck Barbi-Q in Tarifville @ Farmington River
